linda

Interface Linda

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CentralizedLinda, LindaClient

    public interface Linda
    Public interface to a Linda implementation.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void debug(java.lang.String prefix)
      To debug, prints any information it wants (e.g. the tuples in tuplespace or the registered callbacks), prefixed by prefix

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(Tuple t)
        Adds a tuple t to the tuplespace.

      • take

        Tuple take(Tuple template)
        Returns a tuple matching the template and removes it from the tuplespace. Blocks if no corresponding tuple is found.

      • read

        Tuple read(Tuple template)
        Returns a tuple matching the template and leaves it in the tuplespace. Blocks if no corresponding tuple is found.

      • tryTake

        Tuple tryTake(Tuple template)
        Returns a tuple matching the template and removes it from the tuplespace. Returns null if none found.

      • tryRead

        Tuple tryRead(Tuple template)
        Returns a tuple matching the template and leaves it in the tuplespace. Returns null if none found.

      • takeAll

        java.util.Collection<Tuple> takeAll(Tuple template)
        Returns all the tuples matching the template and removes them from the tuplespace. Returns an empty collection if none found (never blocks). Note: there is no atomicity or consistency constraints between takeAll and other methods; for instance two concurrent takeAll with similar templates may split the tuples between the two results.

      • readAll

        java.util.Collection<Tuple> readAll(Tuple template)
        Returns all the tuples matching the template and leaves them in the tuplespace. Returns an empty collection if none found (never blocks). Note: there is no atomicity or consistency constraints between readAll and other methods; for instance (write([1]);write([2])) || readAll([?Integer]) may return only [2].

      • eventRegister

        void eventRegister(Tuple template,
                 Callback callback)
        Registers a callback which will be called when a tuple matching the template appears. The found tuple is removed from the tuplespace. The callback is kept if it returns true, and is deregistered if it returns false. This is the only way to deregister a callback. Note that the callback may immediately fire if a matching tuple is already present. And as long as it returns true, it immediately fires multiple times. Beware: as the firing must wait for the return value of the callback, the callback must never block (see AsynchronousCallback class). Callbacks are not ordered: if more than one may be fired, the chosen one is arbitrary.
        Parameters:
        template - the filtering template.
        callback - the callback to call if a matching tuple appears.

      • debug

        void debug(java.lang.String prefix)
        To debug, prints any information it wants (e.g. the tuples in tuplespace or the registered callbacks), prefixed by prefix
